results.content: I don't know how anyone can watch this one hour video and say they are comfortable with the knowledge of building a CMS from scratch. The instructor is going way too fast, and so it is very difficult to keep up with what he is doing. This course is not for a beginner. It is for someone who has an intermediate to advanced level of knowledge of PHP. I am giving it a 4.5, for the dazzling display of programmatic knowledge of the instructor. It was masterful in that respect. Pure genius.
results.content_html: I don't know how anyone can watch this one hour video and say they are comfortable with the knowledge of building a CMS from scratch. It was masterful in that respect. Pure genius.

results.content: This course has what you need to make a very basic CMS, however, It lacks how to make a "Edit" page and it does not explain how to set it up and a server like XAMPP with PHPMyAdmin. However, if you know how to do these, it is a rather good course.
results.content_html: This course has what you need to make a very basic CMS, however, It lacks how to make a "Edit" page and it does not explain how to set it up and a server like XAMPP with PHPMyAdmin. However, if you know how to do these, it is a rather good course.

results.content: Nice explanation although I think the course should be more complete!

results.content: Actually, the CMS most known as WordPress or Joomla! only offer mysql_() or mysqli_() solutions. But PHP Data Object is the only method to keep safe our information.
results.content_html: Actually, the CMS most known as WordPress or Joomla! only offer mysql_() or mysqli_() solutions. But PHP Data Object is the only method to keep safe our information.

results.content:
I have a feeling this instructor hasn't been doing this for very long. I'd just get a refund and be done with it but I'm outside my 30 days. He is building a CMS in a way that I used to do when I was in my first year of college for web development. Which has a very high risk of being hacked. As from at least what I've seen he is having you place everything in the public folder, which... means it's all accessible to anyone, another issue is he has a direct connection between the template/view file and the database, which is a huge no no.

Perhaps he discusses this stuff later on, and if so please tell me, but from what I have seen here, this course is a poor excuse for 'building a CMS', even a simple one.
results.content_html:
